KH.content: giving form to khōra, schematizing, repeats Plato’s discourse, in which skhemata are the forms which inform khōra, the forms are of it w/out belonging to it
KH.linkedContent: giving form to khōra, schematizing, repeats Plato’s discourse, in which skhemata are the forms which inform khōra, the forms are of it w/out belonging to it

KH.content: khōra never reached, broached [entamer?], touched, exhausted: not subject, not subjectile
KH.linkedContent: khōra never reached, broached [entamer?], touched, exhausted: not subject, not subjectile

KH.content: a virginity rebellious against anthropomorphism, not order of eidos or mimemes
KH.linkedContent: a virginity rebellious against anthropomorphism, not order of eidos or mimemes

KH.content: structure of inclusion in Timaeus: included [2nd] fiction, the theme of the prior fiction, which is its [the 2nd fiction’s] including form, its [the 2nd fiction’s] receptacle > mythopoetic string of events [see p. 121 each fiction as content given form in receptacle of another]
KH.linkedContent: structure of inclusion in Timaeus: included [2nd] fiction, the theme of the prior fiction, which is its [the 2nd fiction’s] including form, its [the 2nd fiction’s] receptacle > mythopoetic string of events [see p. 121 each fiction as content given form in receptacle of another]

KH.content: Plato never qualified khōra as matter (hylè) like Aristotle did
KH.linkedContent: Plato never qualified khōra as matter (hylè) like Aristotle did

BL.content: generic distinction of form/content in literature: form is signifying expression, phenomena of language or rhetoric [don’t confuse form w/ framing]
BL.linkedContent: generic distinction of form/content in literature: form is signifying expression, phenomena of language or rhetoric [don’t confuse form w/ framing]

POO.content: “let us (deconstructionists?) testify (témoignons) to a secret that is without content, without a content separable from its performative experience, from its performative tracing”
POO.linkedContent: “let us (deconstructionists?) testify (témoignons) to a secret that is without content, without a content separable from its performative experience, from its performative tracing”

SPOM.content: when Marx describes anachronistic dislocation (“there the words (Phrase) went beyond the content (Inhalt); here the content goes beyond the words”), he believes in the proper content, appropriate content
SPOM.linkedContent: when Marx describes anachronistic dislocation (“there the words (Phrase) went beyond the content (Inhalt); here the content goes beyond the words”), he believes in the proper content, appropriate content

SPOM.content: animism of wood, already matter becoming-immaterial, what would enlightenment be w/out the market? will there ever be progress w/out exchange-value?
SPOM.linkedContent: animism of wood, already matter becoming-immaterial, what would enlightenment be w/out the market? will there ever be progress w/out exchange-value?

SPOM.content: for Marx, capital contradiction, contradiction of automatic autonomy: 1) inert thing [table] appears inspired, has pneuma or psychē 2) remains caught in heavy thingness of hulē
SPOM.linkedContent: for Marx, capital contradiction, contradiction of automatic autonomy: 1) inert thing [table] appears inspired, has pneuma or psychē 2) remains caught in heavy thingness of hulē

SPOM.content: autonomy the mask of automatism, visor hides absence of living gaze, automaton mimes the living, Thing neither dead nor alive, it survives, war machine, theatrical machine, mekhanē
SPOM.linkedContent: autonomy the mask of automatism, visor hides absence of living gaze, automaton mimes the living, Thing neither dead nor alive, it survives, war machine, theatrical machine, mekhanē

SPOM.content: use-value before exchange value, hulē of wood, ordinary sensuous thing, table before dance > but it must have promised itself to iterability, no use-value w/out possibility of exchange & culture, of an hors-d’usage
SPOM.linkedContent: use-value before exchange value, hulē of wood, ordinary sensuous thing, table before dance > but it must have promised itself to iterability, no use-value w/out possibility of exchange & culture, of an hors-d’usage

POR.content: in-formation does not just offer content, it gives form: “in-formiert”
POR.linkedContent: in-formation does not just offer content, it gives form: “in-formiert”

VP.content: the ideality of ideality, living-present, self-presence of transcendental life; presence always the form, to infinity, through which an infinite diversity of contents will be produced > concrete ideality of “living present” justifies opposition btwn form and content ultimately and radically
VP.linkedContent: the ideality of ideality, living-present, self-presence of transcendental life; presence always the form, to infinity, through which an infinite diversity of contents will be produced > concrete ideality of “living present” justifies opposition btwn form and content ultimately and radically

VP.content: ideality of the form of presence can be repeated to infinity as return of the same, but retained in a finite movement
VP.linkedContent: ideality of the form of presence can be repeated to infinity as return of the same, but retained in a finite movement

VP.content: for Husserl, “S is P” is original apophantic operation, the fundamental, primitive form
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, “S is P” is original apophantic operation, the fundamental, primitive form

VP.content: [Husserl’s formalism, his “pure logical grammar,” limited by semantic theme, the sense determined on basis of relation to object > telos of epistemological rationality is irreducible origin of idea of pure grammar?]
VP.linkedContent: [Husserl’s formalism, his “pure logical grammar,” limited by semantic theme, the sense determined on basis of relation to object > telos of epistemological rationality is irreducible origin of idea of pure grammar?]

FSW.content: when breaching, breaking of path, becomes route (via rupta) opened in nature, in wood (hyle) [see p. 229] > violent inscription of form opposed to writing, route acquires reversibility in time & space
FSW.linkedContent: when breaching, breaking of path, becomes route (via rupta) opened in nature, in wood (hyle) [see p. 229] > violent inscription of form opposed to writing, route acquires reversibility in time & space

DS.content: “reflection” so loaded, reduces text to signified theme > thematicism as eudemonistic or hedonistic
DS.linkedContent: “reflection” so loaded, reduces text to signified theme > thematicism as eudemonistic or hedonistic

DS.content: Freud’s inconsistency re: psychoanalysis of work of art: 1) going beyond formal limits toward theme (Stoff) in service of Lustprinzip 2) says, frustrated, the formal artist is given over to Lustprinzip
DS.linkedContent: Freud’s inconsistency re: psychoanalysis of work of art: 1) going beyond formal limits toward theme (Stoff) in service of Lustprinzip 2) says, frustrated, the formal artist is given over to Lustprinzip

P.content: Kant’s “conceptual scheme” for any theory of art: rational/formal/logical vs. irrational/matter/illogical > thing as formed matter
P.linkedContent: Kant’s “conceptual scheme” for any theory of art: rational/formal/logical vs. irrational/matter/illogical > thing as formed matter

P.content: Heidegger on how blosse Ding is only a remainder (not properly determined in itself), a concept formed alongside, w/in, Christian creationism, matter/form, & concept of Überfall
P.linkedContent: Heidegger on how blosse Ding is only a remainder (not properly determined in itself), a concept formed alongside, w/in, Christian creationism, matter/form, & concept of Überfall

P.content: frame overflowed on 2 borders by what it overflows: it travaille [labors, gives, plays, see TN.] indeed; Kant is undoing the labor of the frame; the structurally bordered origin of surplus value creaks and cracks like wood, never fully exposed
P.linkedContent: frame overflowed on 2 borders by what it overflows: it travaille [labors, gives, plays, see TN.] indeed; Kant is undoing the labor of the frame; the structurally bordered origin of surplus value creaks and cracks like wood, never fully exposed

P.content: for Kant, pure sound & pure color as vibration of ether > purely formal, “universally compatible w/ certainty”—beautiful [what about color gold on frame?]
P.linkedContent: for Kant, pure sound & pure color as vibration of ether > purely formal, “universally compatible w/ certainty”—beautiful [what about color gold on frame?]

OS.content: in MOP, from Parmenides to Husserl, nonpresence always thought in the form of presence (or simply: in the form), past & future are past & future presents
OS.linkedContent: in MOP, from Parmenides to Husserl, nonpresence always thought in the form of presence (or simply: in the form), past & future are past & future presents

OS.content: must think play of submission & subtraction as formal rule to read history of metaphysics w/in opening of Heidegger’s breakthrough [re: categories such as desire, movement, time]
OS.linkedContent: must think play of submission & subtraction as formal rule to read history of metaphysics w/in opening of Heidegger’s breakthrough [re: categories such as desire, movement, time]

GSP.content: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question
GSP.linkedContent: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question

GSP.content: Koffka, disciple of Husserl, argues that “psychology of form” escapes critique of psychologism by means of its structuralism
GSP.linkedContent: Koffka, disciple of Husserl, argues that “psychology of form” escapes critique of psychologism by means of its structuralism

FS.content: form fascinates when one no longer has force to understand force w/in itself [decadence?]
FS.linkedContent: form fascinates when one no longer has force to understand force w/in itself [decadence?]

FS.content: w/in structure there’s not only form, relation & configuration > there’s an interdependency & totality that is always concrete
FS.linkedContent: w/in structure there’s not only form, relation & configuration > there’s an interdependency & totality that is always concrete

FS.content: structure is the formal unity of form & meaning
FS.linkedContent: structure is the formal unity of form & meaning

FS.content: in structuralism, content (living energy of meaning) is neutralized by form > they’ll say this is the author’s responsibility before the critic’s
FS.linkedContent: in structuralism, content (living energy of meaning) is neutralized by form > they’ll say this is the author’s responsibility before the critic’s

FS.content: for Rousset, in the “literary fact” language is one w/ meaning, form belongs to content of work > all possible via imagination’s capacity for metaphor, unifying “form and content”
FS.linkedContent: for Rousset, in the “literary fact” language is one w/ meaning, form belongs to content of work > all possible via imagination’s capacity for metaphor, unifying “form and content”

FS.content: medieval theology (Considérans): all forms, even monsters, beautiful, Formosus means beautiful > form is transcendentally beautifully: it is [Being] and makes things be [creating]
FS.linkedContent: medieval theology (Considérans): all forms, even monsters, beautiful, Formosus means beautiful > form is transcendentally beautifully: it is [Being] and makes things be [creating]

FS.content: Aristotle’s concept of movement: transition to the act, which is itself repose of the desired form
FS.linkedContent: Aristotle’s concept of movement: transition to the act, which is itself repose of the desired form

O.content: modes of presence: meaning, essence, objective or subjective existence, form (i.e. appearance, content, substance), sensible/intelligible presence
O.linkedContent: modes of presence: meaning, essence, objective or subjective existence, form (i.e. appearance, content, substance), sensible/intelligible presence

O.content: lesson of Hegel’s to be maintained even beyond Hegelianism: complicity of empiricism/formalism
O.linkedContent: lesson of Hegel’s to be maintained even beyond Hegelianism: complicity of empiricism/formalism

O.content: neither formalism nor thematism can master irremediable structure of gap btwn empty form/full meaning: will miss it in attempt to master it
O.linkedContent: neither formalism nor thematism can master irremediable structure of gap btwn empty form/full meaning: will miss it in attempt to master it

O.content: Hegel allows for insistence [TN. (in + sistere) “standing firm in”] of a gap btwn form/content, btwn what he calls certainty and truth
O.linkedContent: Hegel allows for insistence [TN. (in + sistere) “standing firm in”] of a gap btwn form/content, btwn what he calls certainty and truth

O.content: Derrida explains many traps Hegel tries to avoid, i.e. rejecting formalism in name of inspiration (Begeisterung)
O.linkedContent: Derrida explains many traps Hegel tries to avoid, i.e. rejecting formalism in name of inspiration (Begeisterung)

O.content: Hegel: math has for its Stoffe dead space & lifeless numerical unit
O.linkedContent: Hegel: math has for its Stoffe dead space & lifeless numerical unit

O.content: Hegel: formalism as superficial analogy, empty application of formula, not inner life of self-movement (Selbstbewegung)
O.linkedContent: Hegel: formalism as superficial analogy, empty application of formula, not inner life of self-movement (Selbstbewegung)

O.content: for Hegel, taxonomies, structures, formalisms offer dead limbs—et autres tableaux that pin down the living to death (épinglant le vif à mort)
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, taxonomies, structures, formalisms offer dead limbs—et autres tableaux that pin down the living to death (épinglant le vif à mort)

O.content: Feuerbach on Hegel as a “game-player”: to Hegel the thinker, formally, absolute idea was an absolute certainty, to Hegel the writer, idea is a formal uncertainty
O.linkedContent: Feuerbach on Hegel as a “game-player”: to Hegel the thinker, formally, absolute idea was an absolute certainty, to Hegel the writer, idea is a formal uncertainty

O.content: tautology & heterology coupled together in speculative proposition > analytic/synthetic procedure mutually envelop each other: no more anteriority, belatedness of form, exteriority of content > concept enriches itself
O.linkedContent: tautology & heterology coupled together in speculative proposition > analytic/synthetic procedure mutually envelop each other: no more anteriority, belatedness of form, exteriority of content > concept enriches itself

O.content: [in field of dissemination] formalism no longer fails (n’échoue) before empirical richness [like in Hegel?] but before une queue, dont le se-mordre [self-bite] n’est ni spéculaire ni symbolique
O.linkedContent: [in field of dissemination] formalism no longer fails (n’échoue) before empirical richness [like in Hegel?] but before une queue, dont le se-mordre [self-bite] n’est ni spéculaire ni symbolique

SW.content: for Freud (the Freud of Penismangel and pseudo-discovery of weaving), mother = matter = materia = Madeira = Holz = hylē
SW.linkedContent: for Freud (the Freud of Penismangel and pseudo-discovery of weaving), mother = matter = materia = Madeira = Holz = hylē

TB.content: Benjamin’s metaphors of core (Kern)/shell, fruit/skin (Frucht/Schale) > core is btwn fruit/skin (tenor [Gehalt]/language [Sprache]) [very nuanced distinctions on all sides]
TB.linkedContent: Benjamin’s metaphors of core (Kern)/shell, fruit/skin (Frucht/Schale) > core is btwn fruit/skin (tenor [Gehalt]/language [Sprache]) [very nuanced distinctions on all sides]

TB.content: still classical oppositional logic: expression before content (for Benjamin, expression is form and opposed to composition, which is usually on the side of form)
TB.linkedContent: still classical oppositional logic: expression before content (for Benjamin, expression is form and opposed to composition, which is usually on the side of form)

CHM.content: silence as madness: irreducible role of haunting language, outside and against which alone language can emerge: “against” designating 1) content from which form takes off by force 2) adversary against which I assure/reassure myself by force [jealous friends of solitude]
CHM.linkedContent: silence as madness: irreducible role of haunting language, outside and against which alone language can emerge: “against” designating 1) content from which form takes off by force 2) adversary against which I assure/reassure myself by force [jealous friends of solitude]

RGE.content: Bataille’s writing, in its major instance [see p. 266 major/minor play, both unknown to master], doesn’t tolerate distinction form/content
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille’s writing, in its major instance [see p. 266 major/minor play, both unknown to master], doesn’t tolerate distinction form/content

Gii.content: for Heidegger, thinking as work of cabinetmaker (Schreiner), a joiner, attune to hidden plenitude of wood’s essence as it enters inhabited site, Handwerk ——[re: Handwerk] w/out attunement to essence of wood, itself attuned to man’s dwelling: empty activity, commerce, taste for profit > (this is Heidegger’s hierarchy & evaluation)
Gii.linkedContent: for Heidegger, thinking as work of cabinetmaker (Schreiner), a joiner, attune to hidden plenitude of wood’s essence as it enters inhabited site, Handwerk ——[re: Handwerk] w/out attunement to essence of wood, itself attuned to man’s dwelling: empty activity, commerce, taste for profit > (this is Heidegger’s hierarchy & evaluation)

REST.content: when shoes no longer have strict relation avec un sujet porteur ou porté—they’re the lightened, anonymous, voided support (but so much the heavier abandoned à son inertie opaque) “of an absent subject whose name haunts the open form”
REST.linkedContent: when shoes no longer have strict relation avec un sujet porteur ou porté—they’re the lightened, anonymous, voided support (but so much the heavier abandoned à son inertie opaque) “of an absent subject whose name haunts the open form”

REST.content: never completely open, the shoe maintains a form, that of the foot > describes external surface or envelope of what is called a “form” [Derrida quotes from Littré, where “form” is wood in shape (figure) of foot, then he links figure to face—Shapiro sees Van Gogh’s in “his” shoes]
REST.linkedContent: never completely open, the shoe maintains a form, that of the foot > describes external surface or envelope of what is called a “form” [Derrida quotes from Littré, where “form” is wood in shape (figure) of foot, then he links figure to face—Shapiro sees Van Gogh’s in “his” shoes]

REST.content: acc. Heidegger, oppositional pairs as Überfall, injure the thing in the thing: hypokeimonon (underneath) or hypostasis/symbebekota (on top) [which becomes in Latin: subjectum (substantia)/accidens], aisthēton/noēton (sensible/intelligible), hylē/eidos-morphē (matter/form-figure)
REST.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, oppositional pairs as Überfall, injure the thing in the thing: hypokeimonon (underneath) or hypostasis/symbebekota (on top) [which becomes in Latin: subjectum (substantia)/accidens], aisthēton/noēton (sensible/intelligible), hylē/eidos-morphē (matter/form-figure)

REST.content: classically, the “thing” is informed matter, Heidegger asks whether this matter/form couple was secretly constituted around thing as work or product (being-product rather than being-thing) > re: Überfall of matter/form couple, has it fallen on the being-thing or being-product? blosse Ding is thing divested of its being-product: what we must think is the Rest
REST.linkedContent: classically, the “thing” is informed matter, Heidegger asks whether this matter/form couple was secretly constituted around thing as work or product (being-product rather than being-thing) > re: Überfall of matter/form couple, has it fallen on the being-thing or being-product? blosse Ding is thing divested of its being-product: what we must think is the Rest

PIO.content: btwn 17th-19th centuries, in the positive notion of rights, only form & composition display invention/originality—not content, “things,” thematics or meaning
PIO.linkedContent: btwn 17th-19th centuries, in the positive notion of rights, only form & composition display invention/originality—not content, “things,” thematics or meaning

RM.content: for Heidegger, Metasprache and Sputnik are the same, monstrous project of father, of metaphysics (mastery of form for form’s sake)
RM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Metasprache and Sputnik are the same, monstrous project of father, of metaphysics (mastery of form for form’s sake)

TR.content: “free signifier” ribbon like Lacan’s purloined letter: content is not important
TR.linkedContent: “free signifier” ribbon like Lacan’s purloined letter: content is not important

TR.content: de Man: w/in certain perspective, no use of language that’s not radically formal, mechanical, even when concealed by aesthetic, formalistic delusions
TR.linkedContent: de Man: w/in certain perspective, no use of language that’s not radically formal, mechanical, even when concealed by aesthetic, formalistic delusions

TR.content: de Man’s materiality: not physical but prosaic resistance to any aesthetic form, not something, nothing, yet it works, materialism as formalism in this materiality w/out matter
TR.linkedContent: de Man’s materiality: not physical but prosaic resistance to any aesthetic form, not something, nothing, yet it works, materialism as formalism in this materiality w/out matter

TR.content: resistance of letter (force of resistance w/out material substance) affects body: dissociative, dismembering, disseminating [materiality w/out matter, formality w/out form]
TR.linkedContent: resistance of letter (force of resistance w/out material substance) affects body: dissociative, dismembering, disseminating [materiality w/out matter, formality w/out form]

TR.content: isolated from its rhetoric [its tropes], grammar is purely formal—de Man: radically formal, mechanical > no text can be produced w/out this formal, grammatical element
TR.linkedContent: isolated from its rhetoric [its tropes], grammar is purely formal—de Man: radically formal, mechanical > no text can be produced w/out this formal, grammatical element

EJQB.content: fragment: neither determined style nor failure, it’s the form of that which is written
EJQB.linkedContent: fragment: neither determined style nor failure, it’s the form of that which is written

AFR.content: good metaphysics, extreme formalization, language of calculus, must reconstitute “metaphysics's prelinguistic and natural base,” it will have been natural & mute > thus, 2 good metaphysics (form, nature): good metaphysics = physics
AFR.linkedContent: good metaphysics, extreme formalization, language of calculus, must reconstitute “metaphysics's prelinguistic and natural base,” it will have been natural & mute > thus, 2 good metaphysics (form, nature): good metaphysics = physics

AFR.content: for Condillac, chain of signs is superstructural, & its principle is formal
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, chain of signs is superstructural, & its principle is formal

D.content: possibility (potency) of present is its own limit, inner fold, impossibility—its impotence (btwn presence/castration) > same goes for “history,” “form”: language of metaphysics
D.linkedContent: possibility (potency) of present is its own limit, inner fold, impossibility—its impotence (btwn presence/castration) > same goes for “history,” “form”: language of metaphysics

D.content: once ether (presence of present) has been called to mind: plupresent not merely presence but deformation irreducible to any form (presence, first matter in the last instance)
D.linkedContent: once ether (presence of present) has been called to mind: plupresent not merely presence but deformation irreducible to any form (presence, first matter in the last instance)

EL.content: for Scholem, separation of form/content (Inhalt/Gestalt) only takes place via degradation, contamination of language > all oppositions are bourgeois mediations [Benjamin]
EL.linkedContent: for Scholem, separation of form/content (Inhalt/Gestalt) only takes place via degradation, contamination of language > all oppositions are bourgeois mediations [Benjamin]

TN.content: for Kant, only man has hand (telos): allows us to explore form, whereas coldness, heat, softness are just “vital”
TN.linkedContent: for Kant, only man has hand (telos): allows us to explore form, whereas coldness, heat, softness are just “vital”

TN.content: for Kant, time is a priori formal condition of all appearances > question of pure auto-affection in movement of temporalization
TN.linkedContent: for Kant, time is a priori formal condition of all appearances > question of pure auto-affection in movement of temporalization

OG.content: Saussure’s reduction of phonic substance removes/opposes form from/to substance (Jakobson critiques glossematics [Hjelmslev] for similar misstep)
OG.linkedContent: Saussure’s reduction of phonic substance removes/opposes form from/to substance (Jakobson critiques glossematics [Hjelmslev] for similar misstep)

OG.content: radical dissimilarity of graphic/phonic excludes derivation [leads to formal truth?]
OG.linkedContent: radical dissimilarity of graphic/phonic excludes derivation [leads to formal truth?]

OG.content: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language

OG.content: writing as possibility of road? violent spacing of nature, silva is savage, via rupta is written, form imposed on hylè
OG.linkedContent: writing as possibility of road? violent spacing of nature, silva is savage, via rupta is written, form imposed on hylè

FV.content: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier

FV.content: structure of fiction reduced when related to its condition of truth, poor formalism which guarantees semantic content, doesn’t account for 1) “scription-fiction” and “scription-fictor” 2) narrating narration & narrator > complicity btwn formalist withdrawal (repli) and hermeneutic semanticism (or psychoanalysis applied to literature)
FV.linkedContent: structure of fiction reduced when related to its condition of truth, poor formalism which guarantees semantic content, doesn’t account for 1) “scription-fiction” and “scription-fictor” 2) narrating narration & narrator > complicity btwn formalist withdrawal (repli) and hermeneutic semanticism (or psychoanalysis applied to literature)
